data.title: The Mark of Zorro
data.meta_description: New York: Grosset and Dunlap, 1924. First Edition. Hardcover. 1st edition. Near fine in a 1st printing jacket having all points as above with a chip at the base of the front panel, some wear, rubs, and 1 fold strengthened, otherwise very good. Near fine / very good. Item #70 Grosset published mostly reprints, but not this one. There was a 1919, abridged version in All–Story
data.text:
New York: Grosset and Dunlap, 1924. First Edition. Hardcover. 1st edition. Near fine in a 1st printing jacket (having all points as above) with a chip at the base of the front panel, some wear, rubs, and 1 fold strengthened, otherwise very good. Near fine / very good. Item #70

Grosset published mostly reprints, but not this one. There was a 1919, abridged version in All–Story Magazine titled The Curse of Capistrano, followed by an expansion of the story (McCulley, Eugene Miller and Douglas Fairbanks using his pen name, Elton Thomas) for the 1920 U. A. film and for our 1924 novel, but reports of a 1920 book edition are a hoax.
